title: Heart of the Himalayas
lyrics_1:
[Verse 1]
सेतो हिमालमा घाम झुल्कियो
काठको मादल मेरो काँधमा छ
चिसो हावाले गाला छुन्छ
बस्ती अब बिस्तारै ब्युँझिदै छ
धुलो उड्नेछ आज यो चौरमा
हातका ठेलाहरूले माटो समात्छन्

[Chorus]
ए! नाचौं है अब साथी हो
हिमाल हाँसेको हेर यहाँ
मुटुको ढुकढुकी यो तालमा छ
(हाम्रो माटो, हाम्रो गौरव)
आवाज देउ ती पहाडहरूलाई
हामी अझै यहाँ छौं भनी
चिच्याएर भन, हामी बाँचिरहेछौं

[Verse 2]
सारंगीको तारमा पुर्खाको स्वर
ओठहरूमा पुरानो भाका छ
पसिनाले भिजेको यो हाम्रो धर्ती
ढुङ्गा र काठको पुरानो नाता
रगतमा बग्छ यो हिउँको पानी
कदम मिलाई अब अघि बढौं

[Bridge]
(हो! हो! हो!)
पैतालाले जमिन थर्काउ
मादलको खरी झन् जोडले पड्काउ
हावामा उड्यो हाम्रो यो जोस
फेरि भन, फेरि गर
हामी ढल्दैनौं, हामी झुक्दैनौं
यो उत्सव जुगौं जुग सम्म

[Chorus]
ए! नाचौं है अब साथी हो
हिमाल हाँसेको हेर यहाँ
मुटुको ढुकढुकी यो तालमा छ
(हाम्रो माटो, हाम्रो गौरव)
आवाज देउ ती पहाडहरूलाई
हामी अझै यहाँ छौं भनी
चिच्याएर भन, हामी बाँचिरहेछौं

[Outro]
सेतो शिखर साक्षी छ
नाच अझै बाँकी छ
(नाचौं है, नाचौं है)
हाम्रो रगत, यो हिमाल
मादल अझै बज्दैछ
(बज्दैछ, बज्दैछ)

title: Whisker Waltz
lyrics_1:
[Verse]
Morning light is dancing on the cobblestone,
Whistling flutes weave a tune all their own.
Baskets of colors, a rainbow so bright,
Handclaps echo in the golden light.

[Pre-Chorus]
Ukulele strums soft and low,
Footsteps tapping, come and go.
Laughter rides the gentle breeze,
Through the rustling market trees.

[Chorus]
Oh, take my hand and stroll with me,
Through the stalls where the spices run free.
Sunny days and melodies sweet,
Every heartbeat’s a rhythm to meet.

[Verse]
Vendors calling in a playful rhyme,
Percussion keeps the swaying time.
Fruit so ripe, it glows like gold,
Stories in the air unfold.

[Pre-Chorus]
Whimsical notes float up high,
Painting dreams across the sky.
Soft tempo hums the afternoon,
A lazy, lovely market tune.

[Chorus]
Oh, take my hand and stroll with me,
Through the stalls where the spices run free.
Sunny days and melodies sweet,
Every heartbeat’s a rhythm to meet.
lyrics_2:
[Verse]
Beneath the oak where shadows play,
A squirrel counts the nuts away,
The breeze it hums a lullaby,
As fireflies light the evening sky.

[Verse]
A fox tiptoes on velvet ground,
His footsteps make the only sound,
The moon peeks through the tangled trees,
And whispers secrets to the leaves.

[Chorus]
Oh, wandering paws and whispering leaves,
Dancing light on the forest eaves,
Every creature knows the tune,
Underneath the silver moon.

[Verse]
A rabbit hops in time so sweet,
To crickets' rhythm, tiny feet,
The owl winks from up above,
And sings a song of endless love.

[Verse]
The badger shuffles through the glen,
Counting stars with his old friend,
The river hums a melody,
Of all the things they used to be.

[Pre-Chorus]
The wind it sighs, the branches sway,
The night is young, come out and play,
The forest hums its ancient rhyme,
One more dance before the daytime.

[Chorus]
Oh, wandering paws and whispering leaves,
Dancing light on the forest eaves,
Every creature knows the tune,
Underneath the silver moon.

lyrics_1:
[Verse 1]
Sweat dripping down my face
The finish line was miles away
I didn’t stop for a breath
Just kept the rhythm in my feet
Every muscle felt the weight
But I refused to slow down

[Pre-Chorus]
The pressure is rising now
Like a wave about to break
(About to break)
Watch me take the giant leap
(Watch me now)

[Chorus]
I got the win today
I’m flying over the crowd
Look at what I can do
It feels so good to be right
Sweetest thing I ever had
Everything is wide open
I am finally alive

[Verse 2]
They told me wait your turn
Stand in line at the back
But I cut through all the noise
I made a path for myself
Now the view is all mine
And it’s better than they said

The pressure is rising now
Like a wave about to break

I got the win today

Sweetest thing I ever had
Everything is wide open
I am finally alive

[Bridge]
(Spoken)
Wait a second...
Do you see that?
I told you I would make it.
Yeah.
Check this out!

I got the win today
I’m flying over the crowd
Look at what I can do
It feels so good to be right
Sweetest thing I ever had
Everything is wide open
I am finally alive

[Outro]
I am finally alive
(So alive)
Yeah, I got the win
(I got the win)
It’s mine now.

title: Electric Heart
lyrics_1:
Intro]
[Acoustic guitar strums quickly, four-on-the-floor stomp begins]
(Hey! Hey! Hey!)

[Verse 1]
The dust was thick on the road.
We waited for the air to break.
Then the sky turned heavy and grey.
The first drop hit the stone.
You didn't run for the porch.
You just looked up and laughed.

[Pre-Chorus]
The heat is finally leaving.
The grass is starting to drink.
My heart is a hammer in my chest.

[Chorus]
We are dancing in the flood.
Water filling up our tracks.
(Hey!)
Let it soak into our bones.
Everything is new again.
(Oh-oh-oh-oh)
We are hollering at the clouds.

[Verse 2]
My shirt is sticking to my back.
The garden is a sea of mud.
We left the windows wide open.
Let the rain wash the floorboards.
There is no ghost in this house today.
Just the sound of our feet hitting dirt.

[Chorus]
We are dancing in the flood.
Water filling up our tracks.
(Hey!)
Let it soak into our bones.
Everything is new again.
(Oh-oh-oh-oh)
We are hollering at the clouds.

[Bridge]
[Music swells with piano and driving percussion]
Dig your heels into the earth.
The storm is a beautiful thing.
(Hey!)
It is a wild and loud mercy.
(Hey!)
We are not hiding anymore.
We are wide awake.

[Post-Chorus]
(Hey! Ho! Hey! Ho!)
(Ooh-ooh-ooh)

[Chorus]
We are dancing in the flood.
Water filling up our tracks.
(Hey!)
Let it soak into our bones.
Everything is new again.
(Oh-oh-oh-oh)
We are hollering at the clouds.

[Outro]
The air is cool and sweet.
Your hand is wet in mine.
(Hey!)
Just the rain.
Just the rain.
[Final stomp and silence]

title: Family Hearth
lyrics_1:
[Instrumental Introduction]
(Fingerpicked nylon-string guitar with a soft cello counterpoint)

[Verse 1]
I dip the nib into the dark ink
The parchment feels heavy in my cold hands
I write your name with care and steady breath
Wishing you peace across the frozen miles

[Verse 2]
The cedar branch bends low with heavy white
A fire crackles within the stone hearth
The scent of orange peel and clove remains
Tied in a ribbon for your late arrival

[Refrain]
Come home to the valley where you began
Let the woodsmoke guide you to the gate
(To the gate)

[Verse 3]
The postman walks the lane in heavy boots
His breath is mist against the biting air
He carries messages of hope and grace
Through every village and the sleeping farm

[Verse 4]
The steam engine cries out across the hill
It carries your heart back to the old woods
I set the table for a weary guest
Laying the silver and the patterned cloth

[Refrain]
Come home to the valley where you began
Let the woodsmoke guide you to the gate
(To the gate)

[Instrumental Bridge]
(A melodic cello solo, swelling with warmth and restraint)

[Verse 5]
We do not need the words upon the page
When the latch lifts and you step inside
The winter card sits by the window pane
A silent witness to our quiet joy

[Outro]
The ink is dry now
The door is open
(Open wide)
[End]

title: Kathmandu Echoes
lyrics_1:
[Verse 1]
I bought a paper ticket in Kathmandu.
The twin otter landed on a mountain ledge.
Red dust covers my leather boots now.
The pack on my back feels like lead.
(The weight of the world)
I walk where the maps are mostly white.
Every step is a debt to my lungs.

[Verse 2]
In Namche the market is loud and bright.
A wool blanket costs more than a week.
The porters carry kerosene and heavy grain.
Their calf muscles look like twisted rope.
(Working for the coin)
They do not look at the snowy peaks.
They look at the dirt beneath their feet.

[Verse 3]
A yak slipped on the ice today.
The driver didn't stop to say a word.
He moved the wood to a different beast.
The valley floor is a long way down.
(Falling out of time)
Life is a thread that snaps in cold.
Hold it tight while the sun stays up.

[Verse 4]
I met a man coming down the pass.
His skin was dark and cracked like clay.
He asked for tobacco and a dry match.
He said the summit is a lonely place.
(Looking at the sky)
The air is thin but it tastes sweet.
I am still here and that is enough.

[Refrain]
The mountain does not care if I breathe.
But I will take another breath anyway.
(Taking another breath anyway)
The mountain does not care if I breathe.
But I will take another breath anyway.

title: Sample Song
lyrics_1:
[Acoustic guitar starts with a steady percussive thump on the body of the instrument]

[Verse 1]
Walking back from the station late
The air is sharp and tastes like rain
I’ve got a hole in my favorite sweater
And a heavy feeling I can’t quite name
We spent the evening talking in circles
About the money and the things we lack
But then you smiled by the hallway heater
And the world just started coming back

[Pre-Chorus]
I’m leaning my head against the door
Listening to you move across the floor
(Listening to you move)

[Chorus]
It’s not a straight line to the top
We’re growing sideways through the cracks
I see you clearly in the morning light
And I’m never looking back
We’re just two different kinds of wood
Building a house that’s actually good
(Building a house that's good)

[Verse 2]
You left your keys on the wooden table
Right next to a half-eaten plate
There’s a stack of mail we haven't opened
And a couple of things we should probably state
I used to want everything to be easy
Like a movie with a perfect end
But I’d rather have the grit and the noise
With my lover and my loudest friend

[Chorus]
It’s not a straight line to the top
We’re growing sideways through the cracks
I see you clearly in the morning light
And I’m never looking back
We’re just two different kinds of wood
Building a house that’s actually good
(Building a house that's good)

[Bridge]
[The piano swells with cinematic string layers]
The garden is messy and the weeds are tall
But the roots are holding onto the wall
It’s not perfect and it’s not clean
But it’s the honest life that I’ve seen
I’m finally standing on solid ground
Knowing exactly what I’ve found

[Chorus]
It’s not a straight line to the top
We’re growing sideways through the cracks
I see you clearly in the morning light
And I’m never looking back
We’re just two different kinds of wood
Building a house that’s actually good
(Building a house that's good)

[Outro]
[Music fades to a single acoustic guitar strum]
Yeah, we’re doing fine
Kicking stones and taking our time
Just taking our time
(In the morning light)
Exactly what I've found.

title: Echoes of Sonesh
lyrics_1:
[Verse 1]
[soft acoustic guitar and piano]
The gravel crunches under my boots
The air is sharp against my skin
I wore the sweater you never liked
It feels warmer than it did back then

[Pre-Chorus]
I expected to see your ghost
Leaning against the heavy oak tree
But the branches are just branches now

[Chorus]
[cello and light percussion enter]
I’m walking through the rain we missed
Relearning how to catch my breath
You’re a chapter I finally finished
I’m not the girl you left behind
(Not that girl anymore)

[Verse 2]
The swings still have that high-pitched squeak
A family is feeding the birds
I used to hide my face in my hands
Right here on this very grass

[Pre-Chorus]
I thought this place would break me
But the sun is breaking through instead
And my heart feels steady and slow

[Chorus]
[building volume and intensity]
I’m walking through the rain we missed
Relearning how to catch my breath
You’re a chapter I finally finished
I’m not the girl you left behind
(Not that girl anymore)

[Bridge]
[electric guitar adds texture]
I am tearing down the old walls
I am building a house for myself
No more looking over my shoulder
To see if you’re following me

[Chorus]
[full anthemic sound]
I’m walking through the rain we missed
Relearning how to catch my breath
You’re a chapter I finally finished
I’m not the girl you left behind
(Not that girl anymore)

[Outro]
[music fades to a single piano note]
Just a park in the afternoon
Moving forward on my own feet
I am breathing
I am finally clean

title: Life's Melody
lyrics_1:
[Verse 1]
My fingers are moving slow
Across the cold metal strings
It didn't sound right yesterday
I was watching the white wall
Waiting for the change to happen
But now it's finally here
It's happening right now

[Chorus]
I think I've got it now
I think I've got it now
(Got it now)
Everything is turning around
Everything is turning around
(Heard the sound)
It finally makes sense

[Verse 2]
The window is open wide
I see the trees moving
The pattern is finally clear
I'm not just watching the room
I'm actually making the noise
Everything looks different today
The colors are coming back

[Chorus]
I think I've got it now
I think I've got it now
(Got it now)
Everything is turning around
Everything is turning around
(Heard the sound)

No more moving in circles
The frustration is leaving my head
I'm letting go of the control
It's a brand new sensation
A better way to be

Walking outside now
Still feeling the rhythm
It’s happening
(It’s happening)
Just keep turning
Moving forward

I finally believe it
(Got it now)
(Got it now)
(Got it now)

title: Homebound Echoes
lyrics_1:
Intro]
(Soft fingerpicked acoustic guitar, steady and warm)

[Verse 1]
The screen door is shaking on its hinge
I see the clover is heavy with dew
A coolness rests on the oak floorboards
The clock in the hall hasn't ticked yet
The sun is a pale stripe on the rug
And the kettle is starting to whistle

[Chorus]
The lavender comes in on the breeze
Trailing from the rows by the fence
I don't have to look for your hand
I know the shape of the space you leave
It is a quiet kind of belonging
Carried on the weight of the air

[Verse 2]
Your book is open on the wicker chair
The tea in the ceramic mug has gone cold
Your garden boots are resting by the mat
Still covered in the dark, damp earth
I like the way the house holds its breath
Before the rest of the world wakes up

[Chorus]
The lavender comes in on the breeze
Trailing from the rows by the fence
I don't have to look for your hand
I know the shape of the space you leave
It is a quiet kind of belonging
Carried on the weight of the air

[Bridge]
Others might crave the noise of the road
Looking for a map to get far away
But I like the way the light hits the wall
And how the scent of the garden stays
(It stays right here)
We don't need to go anywhere today

[Chorus]
The lavender comes in on the breeze
Trailing from the rows by the fence
I don't have to look for your hand
I know the shape of the space you leave
It is a quiet kind of belonging
Carried on the weight of the air

[Outro]
Just a summer wind
The purple stalks nodding in the sun
We are right where we should be
(Right where we should be)
The air is sweet today
(Sweet today)

Intro]
(Soft fingerpicked acoustic guitar, steady and warm)

lyrics:
Intro]
(Sarangi melody over slow, heavy drum beat)

[Verse 1]
पहाडको छातीमा, घाउ गहिरो छ
सुनको लेप लगाएको, विषको खिरो छ
नदी सुक्यो, खेतमा बालुवा मात्रै
हाम्रो पसिना, तिम्रो महलको छाती

[Pre-Chorus]
आँखामा पट्टी बाँधेर, सत्य लुकाउँछौ
यो माटोको ऋण, कसरी चुकाउँछौ?

[Chorus]
भ्रष्टाचार! रगतको मूल्यमा किनिएको न्याय
भ्रष्टाचार! यो देशको आत्मामा लागेको खिया
चोरहरू! मुकुण्डो च्यातेर, आगो बाल्छौं
न्यायको लागि, अब हामी लड्छौं!

[Verse 2]
सडकमा हिँड्दा, पाइला चिप्लिन्छ
हरेक फाइलमा, लोभको छाप देखिन्छ
पुरानो किताबमा, लेखिएको थियो सपना
आज त्यो पाना, तिम्रो हातमा छ, कति सस्तोमा बेच्न?

[Rap Verse]
सुन! यो मेरो आवाज, पहाड चिर्ने धार
सरकारी ढोका, हरेक दिन नयाँ बार
टेबुल मुनि पैसा, कलमको टुप्पोमा डर
मेरो भविष्य बन्धक, तिम्रो बैंक खाता भर
लाइनमा उभिएर, घामले डामेको ज्यान
एउटा सहीको लागि, कति दिनको बलिदान?
तिमीले खायौ देश, हड्डीसम्म चुस्यौ
अब यो आन्दोलन, तिम्रो लागि मृत्यु!

[Chorus]
भ्रष्टाचार! रगतको मूल्यमा किनिएको न्याय
भ्रष्टाचार! यो देशको आत्मामा लागेको खिया
चोरहरू! मुकुण्डो च्यातेर, आगो बाल्छौं
न्यायको लागि, अब हामी लड्छौं!

[Bridge]
हिमाल रोयो, हिउँ पग्लियो रगतमा
यो मौनता होइन, यो त तूफानको सुरुवात
जसले बिर्सियो माटो, उसले बिर्सियो धर्म
अब हिसाब हुन्छ, हरेक कर्मको मर्म

[Chorus]
भ्रष्टाचार! रगतको मूल्यमा किनिएको न्याय
भ्रष्टाचार! यो देशको आत्मामा लागेको खिय

Intro]

I watch the silver lines today
Heavy rain falls on the bank

[Chorus]

[Chorus]
Let the current carry the weight
Soft water moving slow
I find the words in the tide
Turning over and over
(Moving slow)

[Outro]
The river knows the way
The river knows

(Fading out)
(Fading)

I will stay

(Stay)

prompt: Aggressive folk metal, blending heavy distorted guitars and double bass drumming with traditional Nepali instruments (Sarangi, flute), incorporating intense rap verses and a powerful, anthemic chorus. High energy, political theme.
lyrics:
[Intro]
(Sarangi melody over slow, heavy drum beat)

[Verse 1]
पहाडको छातीमा, घाउ गहिरो छ
सुनको लेप लगाएको, विषको खिरो छ
नदी सुक्यो, खेतमा बालुवा मात्रै
हाम्रो पसिना, तिम्रो महलको छाती

[Pre-Chorus]
आँखामा पट्टी बाँधेर, सत्य लुकाउँछौ
यो माटोको ऋण, कसरी चुकाउँछौ?

[Chorus]
भ्रष्टाचार! रगतको मूल्यमा किनिएको न्याय
भ्रष्टाचार! यो देशको आत्मामा लागेको खिया
चोरहरू! मुकुण्डो च्यातेर, आगो बाल्छौं
न्यायको लागि, अब हामी लड्छौं!

[Verse 2]
सडकमा हिँड्दा, पाइला चिप्लिन्छ
हरेक फाइलमा, लोभको छाप देखिन्छ
पुरानो किताबमा, लेखिएको थियो सपना
आज त्यो पाना, तिम्रो हातमा छ, कति सस्तोमा बेच्न?

[Rap Verse]
सुन! यो मेरो आवाज, पहाड चिर्ने धार
सरकारी ढोका, हरेक दिन नयाँ बार
टेबुल मुनि पैसा, कलमको टुप्पोमा डर
मेरो भविष्य बन्धक, तिम्रो बैंक खाता भर
लाइनमा उभिएर, घामले डामेको ज्यान
एउटा सहीको लागि, कति दिनको बलिदान?
तिमीले खायौ देश, हड्डीसम्म चुस्यौ
अब यो आन्दोलन, तिम्रो लागि मृत्यु!

[Chorus]
भ्रष्टाचार! रगतको मूल्यमा किनिएको न्याय
भ्रष्टाचार! यो देशको आत्मामा लागेको खिया
चोरहरू! मुकुण्डो च्यातेर, आगो बाल्छौं
न्यायको लागि, अब हामी लड्छौं!

[Bridge]
हिमाल रोयो, हिउँ पग्लियो रगतमा
यो मौनता होइन, यो त तूफानको सुरुवात
जसले बिर्सियो माटो, उसले बिर्सियो धर्म
अब हिसाब हुन्छ, हरेक कर्मको मर्म

[Chorus]
भ्रष्टाचार! रगतको मूल्यमा किनिएको न्याय
भ्रष्टाचार! यो देशको आत्मामा लागेको खिया
चोरहरू! मुकुण्डो च्यातेर, आगो बाल्छौं
न्यायको लागि, अब हामी लड्छौं!

[Outro]
लड्छौं!
आगो बाल्छौं!
(Heavy riff fades out with fast Sarangi/Flute counter-melody)

prompt.S:
A folk metal song in nepali with raps and a heavy chorus about corruption

Lyrics:
[Intro]
(Sarangi melody over slow, heavy drum beat)

[Verse 1]
पहाडको छातीमा, घाउ गहिरो छ
(Pahadko chhatima, ghau gahiro chha)
सुनको लेप लगाएको, विषको खिरो छ
(Sunko lep lagayeko, bishko khiro chha)
नदी सुक्यो, खेतमा बालुवा मात्रै
(Nadi sukyo, khetma baluwa matrai)
हाम्रो पसिना, तिम्रो महलको छाती
(Hamro pasina, timro mahalko chhati)

[Pre-Chorus]
आँखामा पट्टी बाँधेर, सत्य लुकाउँछौ
(Aankhama patti bandhera, satya lukaunchhau)
यो माटोको ऋण, कसरी चुकाउँछौ?
(Yo matoko rin, kasari chukaunchhau?)

[Chorus]
भ्रष्टाचार! रगतको मूल्यमा किनिएको न्याय
(Bhrashtachar! Ragatko mulyama kinieko nyay)
भ्रष्टाचार! यो देशको आत्मामा लागेको खिया
(Bhrashtachar! Yo deshko aatmamā lāgeko khiyā)
चोरहरू! मुकुण्डो च्यातेर, आगो बाल्छौं
(Chorharu! Mukundo chyatera, aago bālchhau)
न्यायको लागि, अब हामी लड्छौं!
(Nyayko lagi, aba hami ladchhau!)

[Verse 2]
सडकमा हिँड्दा, पाइला चिप्लिन्छ
(Sadakma hidnda, paila chiplinchha)
हरेक फाइलमा, लोभको छाप देखिन्छ
(Harek filema, lobhko chhap dekhinchha)
पुरानो किताबमा, लेखिएको थियो सपना
(Purano kitabma, lekhieko thiyo sapana)
आज त्यो पाना, तिम्रो हातमा छ, कति सस्तोमा बेच्न?
(Aaja tyo pana, timro hatma chha, kati sastoma bechna?)

[Rap Verse]
सुन! यो मेरो आवाज, पहाड चिर्ने धार
(Suna! Yo mero aawaj, pahad chirne dhaar)
सरकारी ढोका, हरेक दिन नयाँ बार
(Sarkari dhoka, harek din naya baar)
टेबुल मुनि पैसा, कलमको टुप्पोमा डर
(Tebul muni paisa, kalamko tuppoma dar)
मेरो भविष्य बन्धक, तिम्रो बैंक खाता भर
(Mero bhavishya bandhak, timro bank khata bhar)
लाइनमा उभिएर, घामले डामेको ज्यान
(Line ma ubhiyera, ghamle dameko jyan)
एउटा सहीको लागि, कति दिनको बलिदान?
(Euta sahi ko lagi, kati dinko balidan?)
तिमीले खायौ देश, हड्डीसम्म चुस्यौ
(Timile khayau desh, haddisamma chusyau)
अब यो आन्दोलन, तिम्रो लागि मृत्यु!
(Aba yo andolan, timro lagi mrityu!)

[Chorus]
भ्रष्टाचार! रगतको मूल्यमा किनिएको न्याय
(Bhrashtachar! Ragatko mulyama kinieko nyay)
भ्रष्टाचार! यो देशको आत्मामा लागेको खिया
(Bhrashtachar! Yo deshko aatmamā lāgeko khiyā)
चोरहरू! मुकुण्डो च्यातेर, आगो बाल्छौं
(Chorharu! Mukundo chyatera, aago bālchhau)
न्यायको लागि, अब हामी लड्छौं!
(Nyayko lagi, aba hami ladchhau!)

[Bridge]
हिमाल रोयो, हिउँ पग्लियो रगतमा
(Himal royo, hiun pagliyo ragatma)
यो मौनता होइन, यो त तूफानको सुरुवात
(Yo maunata hoina, yo ta toofan ko suruwaat)
जसले बिर्सियो माटो, उसले बिर्सियो धर्म
(Jasle birsiyo mato, usle birsiyo dharma)
अब हिसाब हुन्छ, हरेक कर्मको मर्म
(Aba hisab hunchha, harek karmako marma)

[Chorus]
भ्रष्टाचार! रगतको मूल्यमा किनिएको न्याय
(Bhrashtachar! Ragatko mulyama kinieko nyay)
भ्रष्टाचार! यो देशको आत्मामा लागेको खिया
(Bhrashtachar! Yo deshko aatmamā lāgeko khiyā)
चोरहरू! मुकुण्डो च्यातेर, आगो बाल्छौं
(Chorharu! Mukundo chyatera, aago bālchhau)
न्यायको लागि, अब हामी लड्छौं!
(Nyayko lagi, aba hami ladchhau!)

[Outro]
लड्छौं! (Ladchhau!)
आगो बाल्छौं! (Aago Balchhau!)
(Heavy riff fades out with fast Sarangi/Flute counter-melody)

title: Sample Song
lyrics_1:
[Verse 1]
The mud is up to my shins.
My boots are heavy with the weight.
I’m moving through the dead wood.
Scraping my knuckles on the rough bark.
It’s not a moment of grace.
It’s just hard work in the cold.
I stopped looking for a sign
and started looking for a way out.

[Chorus]
Finally clear.
The ridge is sharp.
The view is plain.
I see the edge.
(I see the edge)
Finally clear.

[Verse 2]
I used to like the thicket.
It was easy to be lost and quiet.
Nobody asks where you are going
when you look like you’re already there.
I’ve got sap under my fingernails
and the air is getting thin.
The trees are thinning out too.
I don't miss the cover.

[Chorus]
Finally clear.
The ridge is sharp.
The view is plain.
I see the edge.
(I see the edge)
Finally clear.

[Bridge]
It’s not how I thought it would look.
No magic, just a lot of space.
I can see the town from here.
Everything looks small and fixable.
I’m not hiding anymore.
I’m just standing on the rock.

[Chorus]
Finally clear.
The ridge is sharp.
The view is plain.
I see the edge.
(I see the edge)
Finally clear.
(I see the edge)
Finally clear.

title: Life's Calm
lyrics_1:
Intro]
(Electric piano solo, spacious and warm)
(Low, steady bass line enters)

[Verse 1]
Holding this heat in my palms
The ceramic is heavy and smooth
Outside the frost is alive
Pressing against the pane
But here we are slow
Moving like the heavy air

[Chorus]
Stay within the steam
Let the world fall away
Just you and the slow rise
Deep in the marrow
Sweet, quiet grace
(Sweet grace)

[Verse 2]
Your eyes are soft in the vapor
No words are needed now
We are a small island
A sanctuary from the wind
Everything else is just noise
Lost in the porcelain

[Chorus]
Stay within the steam
Let the world fall away
Just you and the slow rise
Deep in the marrow
Sweet, quiet grace
(So sweet)

[Bridge]
(Instrumental solo: Muted trumpet or saxophone)
(Music swells slightly then subsides into a groove)

[Chorus]
Stay within the steam
Let the world fall away
Just you and the slow rise
Deep in the marrow
Sweet, quiet grace
(Holding on to the grace)

[Outro]
The ice can have the sky
We have the warmth
Just for a moment
(Just stay)
So calm
Deep and slow
(Fade out with melodic ad-libs)

sounds_2: Hip-Hop, Melodic Jazz-Hop, Downtempo, mellow grand piano, warm upright bass, soft brush boom-bap drums, vinyl crackle, calm masculine vocals, conversational and breathy delivery, wistful and bittersweet mood, grounded and sincere timbre, pastoral urban serenity, 88 BPM, Key of C Minor.

title: Serenity
lyrics_1:
Intro - Mellow grand piano melody with soft vinyl crackle]

[Verse 1]
The wood of the porch feels cool against my palms.
The sun is a pale coin sinking behind the ridge.
I sit where the grass meets the gravel path.
Everything is still, holding its breath for the shift.
Then the old elm tree begins to sway and ripple.
A sudden rush of grey wings breaks the silence.
One bird leads, and a thousand others follow the curve.
They move like a single lung breathing in the sky.
There is no map, only the pull of the north.
The weight I carried all day starts to thin out.
I watch them scatter and pull back into a line.
They do not ask for permission to leave the earth.
My eyes trace the pattern until they are specks.
The air feels lighter once the noise has passed.
I remain here, anchored but somehow less heavy.
The horizon is just a promise of a quiet night.

[Chorus]
(They drift as one, a ribbon in the blue)
I stay behind and let the gravity go.
(Finding the path without a single word)
The sky is wide enough for every heavy heart.

[Instrumental Break - 8 bars - Piano solo over a soft boom-bap rhythm]

[Verse 2]
The silence that returns is deeper than before.
A single feather floats down to the damp soil.
I pick it up, feeling the hollow stem between fingers.
It is a small fragment of a much larger journey.
I wonder if they feel the wind or just become it.
There is a grace in knowing when to move on.
The trees are empty now, but they do not look lonely.
They stand tall, waiting for the next season to arrive.
My breath follows the rhythm of that distant ascent.
Why carry what the wind is willing to take?
The blue fades into a soft, bruised purple.
The first star is a quiet point in the vastness.
I am a small part of this slow, turning world.
There is peace in being the one who stays.
I close my eyes and hear the leaves finally settle.
The cycle is complete, and the earth is still.

[Outro - Long, fading instrumental with piano and distant wind chimes]
(Let it go)
(Let it flow)
(The sky is wide)
(The sky is wide)
lyrics_2:
Intro - Mellow grand piano melody with soft vinyl crackle]

title: Life's Melody
lyrics_1:
Intro]
(Slow, rising tremolo strings)
(Timpani roll, distant and muffled)

[Section A]
The heavy ropes fall.
Iron slides against the wood.
The land is a thin line now.
Gray stone.
Quiet dust.
We leave it all.

[Section B]
The canvas pulls.
Breath of the great blue.
Higher.
Into the sun.
No fear in the salt.
Only the wide world.

[Section C]
(Ah... Ah... Ah...)
(Vocalise rising to an operatic peak)
The water breaks.
White spray on the glass.
We rise above the crest.
Beyond the edge.
Infinite.

[Crescendo]
(Ah... Ah... Ah...)
(Choir joins, fortissimo)
The horizon opens its arms.
The weight is gone.
Further.
Always further.

[Finale]
(Grand orchestration fades into a single trumpet note)
New light.
The sea.
Home.
(Ah...)

title: Roar of the Wild
lyrics_1:
Intro]
[Solo piano enters with a slow, minor-key melody, joined by a low, mournful cello]

[Verse 1]
The long grass bends before a heavy weight.
A rhythmic breath parts the morning damp.
He moves like water over the jagged stone.
Unseen until the air begins to tremble.
The silence here is older than the trees.
A heavy paw-print fills with grey rain.

[Chorus]
Sovereign of the deep wood and the brush.
Born of orange heat and cooling ash.
Your stride is the pulse of the living world.
A power that needs no words to rule.
You are the law written in teeth and bone.

[Verse 2]
Two eyes of amber burn within the thicket.
The stag stands frozen in the silver light.
There is no malice in the coming strike.
Only the turning of a heavy wheel.
The great hunter claims what the earth provides.
A single motion ends the long wait.

[Chorus]
Sovereign of the deep wood and the brush.
Born of orange heat and cooling ash.
Your stride is the pulse of the living world.
A power that needs no words to rule.
You are the law written in teeth and bone.

[Bridge]
(Ah, oh, ah)
[The orchestra swells to a fortissimo peak with crashing percussion and soaring violins]
(The earth yields)
(The spirit is reclaimed)

[Outro]
The striped coat vanishes into the thick mist.
The mountain watches his quiet retreat.
Rest now, king of the lonely high places.
The world remains under your heavy gaze.
[Solo piano returns, fading slowly into a final, sustained cello note]

title: Kathmandu Dawn
lyrics_1:
Intro]
(Acoustic guitar in open tuning, joined by the mournful, sliding notes of a sarangi)

[Verse 1]
The frost is thick on the temple gate
I walk where the red trees grow tall
My breath is a cloud in the grey morning
We carry the weight of the steep climb
My fingers are stiff around the bow
Waiting for the wind to go quiet

[Chorus]
Play the string until the mountains move
Let the wood sing against the cold
The song will fly through the high pass
(The song will fly through the pass)
We are alive in the thin blue air
The sound will find the path home

[Verse 2]
I remember the fire in the valley
You were there by the low stone wall
Now the track is lost in the deep white
And the prayer flags are torn by the gale
I see the shape of the mountain peaks
They know the music of my kin

[Chorus]
Play the string until the mountains move
Let the wood sing against the cold
The song will fly through the high pass
(The song will fly through the pass)
We are alive in the thin blue air
The sound will find the path home

[Vocal Bridge]
(Ooh, ooh, ooh)
(Ah, ah, ah)
(The melody rises with the sarangi, swelling in harmony)

[Chorus]
Play the string until the mountains move
Let the wood sing against the cold
The song will fly through the high pass
(The song will fly through the pass)
We are alive in the thin blue air
The sound will find the path home

[Outro]
The wind is a voice I know well
It carries the notes down the slope
The sarangi rests in my tired arms
We are home before the sun goes low
(We are home)
(The sound will find the path home)
(A final, long-sustained sarangi note fades into the sound of wind)

title: Fin-tastic Melody
lyrics_1:
[Verse 1]
I tripped on the ice again.
My flippers are way too long.
The colony thinks I’m a freak.
They just stand there and stare.
I’m sick of this frozen rock.
The wind is biting my face.

[Pre-Chorus]
Stop telling me I’m crazy.
You don’t know what I’m planning.
(He's lost it)

[Chorus]
I’m building a boat out of kelp.
Sailing straight to the North Pole.
It’s green and it’s slimy and real.
Watch me leave you all behind.
(Watch him go)

[Verse 2]
The old walrus joined my crew.
He’s got scars and yellow tusks.
He says the currents are rough.
I told him to just shut up.
He’s the only one who gets it.
He smells like salt and seaweed.

[Pre-Chorus]
Stop laughing at my sticky raft.
It’s stronger than it looks.
(It's gonna sink)

[Chorus]
I’m building a boat out of kelp.
Sailing straight to the North Pole.
It’s green and it’s slimy and real.
Watch me leave you all behind.

[Bridge]
My knots are coming undone.
I’m soaking wet and freezing.
I don’t need your help anyway.
I’d rather sink than stay here.
Yeah, I’m a total disaster.
And I like it that way.

[Chorus]
I’m building a boat out of kelp.
Sailing straight to the North Pole.
It’s green and it’s slimy and real.
Watch me leave you all behind.
(Leave us behind)

[Outro]
Just me and the walrus.
Heading North.
Don’t follow me.
(Don't follow him)
Get out of my way.

title: Kathmandu Rhythms
lyrics_1:
intro with driving rhythm and hand drums]

[Verse 1]
Come sisters, come brothers, lace the leather tight
The path is built of jagged rock and stone
We leave the river bed before the sun is high
To find the square where all the flutes are heard
(Where the flutes are heard)
Our heavy packs are swinging on our backs
The dust is rising from the narrow trail

[Chorus]
High in the clouds where the silver peaks stand
Spin the wheel and let the banners fly
The drum beats loud against the granite wall
We dance beneath the wide and open air
(Under the open air)

[Verse 2]
The yaks are coming down the steep and frozen pass
The iron bells are ringing on their necks
We bring the scarlet silk and heavy bags of grain
To spread them on the dry and yellow grass
(On the yellow grass)
The elder men are pouring out the tea
The copper pots are heavy in their hands

[Chorus]
High in the clouds where the silver peaks stand
Spin the wheel and let the banners fly
The drum beats loud against the granite wall
We dance beneath the wide and open air
(Under the open air)

[Bridge]
Look yonder where the ice begins to break
The rhododendron blooms upon the slope
Five colors snap and whistle in the wind
To carry every word across the world

[Chorus]
High in the clouds where the silver peaks stand
Spin the wheel and let the banners fly
The drum beats loud against the granite wall
We dance beneath the wide and open air
(Under the open air)

[Outro]
The sun is dropping down behind the ridge
The fire is jumping in the central ring
We walk together to the valley floor
(To the valley floor)
The mountain stands behind us in the dark
(Stands in the dark)
Heave away, the journey is our home.

[Final acoustic strum]

(To the valley floor)
The mountain stands behind us in the dark
(Stands in the dark)
Heave away, the journey is our home.

[Final acoustic strum]

prompt: Warm acoustic Christmas, gentle guitar, soft percussion, nostalgic holiday vibe, mellow tempo, heartfelt storytelling, subtle sleigh bells
title: Family Hearth
lyrics_1:
[Verse]
The embers glow like distant stars,
Crackling low on hardwood bars.
Grandma's quilt around my knees,
Snowflakes dance in the winter breeze.

[Verse]
Dad strums the old guitar so slow,
Mom hums the tunes I used to know.
Cinnamon swirls in the air,
Pine needles caught in my hair.

[Chorus]
Oh, sing me back to candlelight,
Where every shadow holds delight.
Wrapped in love and sugarplum dreams,
This fireside carol softly gleams.

[Bridge]
The mantel clock chimes midnight clear,
But no one sleeps when Christmas nears.
We trace our names on frosted panes,
Like echoes down a memory lane.

[Verse]
Uncle Joe tells tales so tall,
Of reindeer hooves on rooftops fall.
Baby sister's eyelids droop,
Cradled safe in angels' stoop.

[Pre-Chorus]
The last log sighs a golden spark,
Painting hymns upon the dark.

[Chorus]
Oh, sing me back to candlelight,
Where every shadow holds delight.
Wrapped in love and sugarplum dreams,
This fireside carol softly gleams.
lyrics_2:
[Verse]
The streetlights glow on powdered roads,
Whispers hum through frosted panes.
Your scarf still smells of cinnamon,
As the snowflakes dance their slow refrain.

[Verse]
The old guitar hums a lullaby,
Strings worn thin from years of cheer.
We trace our names on foggy glass,
While the world outside disappears.

[Chorus]
Oh, snowfall serenade, sing me home,
Through the hush of December's glow.
Every note a memory we've known,
Wrapped in the light of the softly falling snow.

[Bridge]
Sleigh bells chime in distant yards,
A fleeting tune, a fleeting spark.
But here with you, the fire's warm,
And the night melts into the dark.

[Verse]
The clock ticks slow like a waltz undone,
Embers crackle, stories rise.
Your laughter lingers in the air,
Like the ghost of Christmas lights.

[Pre-Chorus]
The years may fade, the seasons turn,
But this melody won't let go.

[Chorus]
Oh, snowfall serenade, sing me home,
Through the hush of December's glow.
Every note a memory we've known,
Wrapped in the light of the softly falling snow.

[Chorus]
Oh, snowfall serenade, sing me home,
Where the past and the present flow.
Like the snow that settles soft and slow,
We’re right where we’re meant to go.

title: Echoes of the Unknown
lyrics_1:
Intro]
[8 measures of felt piano with a rhythmic, clock-like ticking motif]
[Low, atmospheric synths swell slowly like a rising tide]

[Stanza A]
The air is heavy with brine.
It moves the gate.
A hinge that needs oil.
A sound I used to know.
It repeats.
And rises.
And falls back to the dry grass.

[Stanza B]
I try to name the tune.
It is thin like old lace.
Woven into the damp.
I am waiting for a footfall.
But the path is grown over.
Green.
And quiet.
(And quiet)

[Interlude]
[12 measures of solo oboe mimicking a drifting melody]
[Arpeggiated cello adds a sense of urgent, winding movement]

[Stanza A Variation]
The salt settles on my skin.
Turning.
Winding through the pines.
A pattern of birds.
They do not look back.
I remember the color.
But the face is gone.

[Coda]
Just the wind.
Moving the gate.
Again.
And again.
[Piano rhythm slows and eventually stops mid-phrase]

title: Sunlit Melody
lyrics_1:
[Verse 1]
I stepped across the bluestone path
Near the Widener Library steps
The air is crisp, the sky is clear
A sharp Atlantic weather pattern
In my pocket, a folded portrait
Jackson’s face on a linen blend
A forgotten twenty, a small mandate
Of temporary fiscal solvency

[Chorus]
Oh, the day is classically sound
The architecture of the afternoon
(Everything is aligned)
No footnotes required for this joy
A sudden surplus in the ledger
The wind is playing the iron railings

[Verse 2]
Observe the dentil molding there
Above the shop selling linen shirts
I’ll buy a seltzer and a magazine
And sit where the angles are clipped
The cobblestones are curated well
My gait is light, my posture improved
By an unexpected green windfall
Tucked inside a vintage herringbone

[Chorus]
Oh, the day is classically sound
The architecture of the afternoon
(Everything is aligned)
No footnotes required for this joy
A sudden surplus in the ledger
The wind is playing the iron railings

[Bridge]
(Staccato string quartet break)
It’s a diplomatic immunity
From the typical Tuesday weight
A sudden cessation of debts
A moment of sheer provenance

[Chorus]
Oh, the day is classically sound
The architecture of the afternoon
(Everything is aligned)
No footnotes required for this joy
A sudden surplus in the ledger
The wind is playing the iron railings

[Outro]
(Abrupt stop on a harpsichord chord)

title: Kathmandu Rhythms
lyrics_1:
[Verse 1]
[Acoustic guitar starts with a steady, driving strum. Hand-claps every second beat.]
Eight miles up the broken track
With the ice biting at our boots
We carry the wood on our backs
Walking where the air is loose
We reached the gates of Namche
With the dust stuck in our teeth
Looking for a place to lay
Searching for the heat beneath

[Chorus]
[Full band enters. Heavy foot stomps. High energy.]
Oh, pass the bowl around the table
Let the steam rise to the roof
We are strong and we are able
And the heart is all the proof
Hey! Hey!
(We are warm now)
Hey! Hey!
(We are home)

[Verse 2]
[Mandolin and bansuri flute join. Percussive and upbeat.]
Tashi stirs the heavy pot
The iron smells of salt and smoke
Give me everything you’ve got
Share the bread that we just broke
The windows turn to milky white
Hiding all the jagged peaks
We don’t need the sun tonight
With the fire on our cheeks

[Chorus]
Oh, pass the bowl around the table
Let the steam rise to the roof
We are strong and we are able
And the heart is all the proof
Hey! Hey!
(We are warm now)
Hey! Hey!
(We are home)

[Bridge]
[Music drops to just stomps and a single guitar note. Building intensity.]
Let the wind howl at the door
(Let it howl)
Let the frost crawl on the floor
(Let it crawl)
We have silver in our cups
(In our cups)
And the mountain can’t touch us
(It can't touch us)
Hey!

[Chorus]
[Maximum volume. Gang vocals. Cymbals crashing.]
Oh, pass the bowl around the table
Let the steam rise to the roof
We are strong and we are able
And the heart is all the proof
Hey! Hey!
(We are warm now)
Hey! Hey!
(We are home)

[Outro]
[Gradually fading to just the madal drum and claps.]
The salt and the steam
(We are home)
The salt and the steam
(We are home)
In the stone house
In the high wind
We are home.
